mortality.note: Deaths from military action, famine, and disease during 24-year occupation. UN CAVR commission documented systematic violations.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Indonesian military occupation, forced displacement, famine policies, sterilization.
rationales.profit: Oil and gas resources in Timor Sea. Strategic location.
rationales.ideology: Anti-communist rationale (Fretilin), but primarily territorial annexation.
rationales.complicity: US, Australia, UK armed Indonesia. International community ignored until 1999.

analysis.pattern_note: Invasion occurred day after US President Ford visited Jakarta. Western powers armed Indonesia and blocked UN action. Up to 25% of population killed. Independence finally achieved in 2002 after UN intervention.
analysis.root_causes: Indonesian expansionism, Cold War anti-communism, oil interests, international complicity
